intro: Austrostipa exilis, commonly known as the slender wiregrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its fine, wiry stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. Austrostipa exilis produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small invertebrates.
